intro: Crucianella chlorostachys, commonly known as the green-stemmed sea bean, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is a small shrub that typically grows in coastal areas, characterized by its succulent, green stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, pale blue or white flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. It is adapted to saline and sandy environments, making it a common species in maritime regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of coastal vegetation and a subject of interest in ecological studies.
